section.title: Description
section.b: This step tries to locate a link (like Follow me) and to click on it. The page where this click leads to will be the current one for further actions.

pre.b: The different ways to locate a link are applied in this sequence:

li.dd: If htmlid is set: the link with the given id is used (and the step fails if no link is found with this id)
Else the first link containing the specified label (if specified) and href (if specified) is used
If not found, the first link containing an image (IMG) tag with label as the ALT attribute is used ( href is ignored)

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: The description of this test step.

attribute.name: href
attribute.description: A substring of the HTML anchor tag's HREF attribute for the link of interest. Useful if (part of the href) uniquely identifies a link (for example, a unique parameter/value pair in the href). Also, useful for distinguisking between links with the same labels (in which case, use label and href combined). Either label, href or htmlId is required. Href has the lowest precedence.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: The label of the element to click. One of 'label', 'htmlid' or 'xpath' must be set.

attribute.name: htmlId
attribute.description: The htmlId of the element to click. One of 'label', 'htmlid' or 'xpath' must be set.

attribute.name: xpath
attribute.description: The xpath of the element to click. One of 'label', 'htmlid' or 'xpath' must be set.

attribute.name: username
attribute.description: A username that can be provided for pages that require basic authentication. Typically only needed on the first step of any accessing a secure site. Required if password is specified.

attribute.name: password
attribute.description: A password that can be provided for pages that require basic authentication. Required if username is specified.

attribute.name: save
attribute.description: A shorthand: save='prefixName' is the same as savePrefix='prefixName' saveResponse='true'.

attribute.name: savePrefix
attribute.description: A name prefix can be specified for making a permanent copy of received responses. A unique number and the file extension (depending on the MIME-Type) will be appended. The resultpath attribute of the <config> element is used for determining the location of the saved result.
attribute.required: no, default is the 'savePrefix' parameter as specified in <config>.

attribute.name: saveResponse
attribute.description: Whether to make a permanent copy of received responses. Overrides the default value set in the <config> element.

section.title: Inline Text

attribute.name: text
attribute.description: Alternative way to set the 'label' attribute.
